com.sun.xacml.test
Class TestUtil

java.lang.Object
  com.sun.xacml.test.TestUtil

public class TestUtil
extends java.lang.Object

Simple utility class that provides some equality methods for testing whether evaluation results match.

Author:
Seth Proctor

Method Detail

areEquivalent

public static boolean areEquivalent(ResponseCtx response1,
                                    ResponseCtx response2)
Returns whether two XACML Responses are equivalent.

Parameters:
response1 - an XACML Response
response2 - an XACML Response
Returns:
true if the responses are equivalent, false otherwise

areEquivalent

public static boolean areEquivalent(Status status1,
                                    Status status2)
Compares two XACML Status elements to see if they're equivalent.

NOTE: there's no clear way to support comparing status detail or messages, since they're both non-standard and can contain arbitrary content. As a result, this isn't supported at present.

Parameters:
status1 - status data
status2 - status data
Returns:
true if the two sets of status data are equivalent, false otherwise

areEquivalent

public static boolean areEquivalent(java.util.Set obs1,
                                    java.util.Set obs2)
Compares two sets to see if they contain equivalent obligations

Parameters:
obs1 - a Set of Obligations
obs2 - a Set of Obligations
Returns:
true if the sets are equivalent, false otherwise
